Killed instantly

Hands remove the gauze bandages covering her eyes. The area around them is black and bruised, scabbed. She tries to focus -- Panic begins when she realizes she can't see --
I can't see...
...the impact from the bullet exploding out of the       gun...
I can't see.

Light. Shapes. Everything's blurred. Nothing's            clear.

Will I be blind?
There's no way to tell right now.
Jenny begins to quietly weep...
I'm Sergeant Chang from the police. Did you see the       man who did this to you?
Her face changes as she remembers --
Could you describe him?
As Jenny remembers him. Jeff standing full front -- Both hands hang at his sides... He raises the hand with a PISTOL. Levels it straight at CAMERA. FIRES. A WASH OF BLOOD seeps across the screen --

Please leave me alone.

Please.

Chang and a UNIFORMED COP wait by the passport control de The Uniform directs Chang's attention to A BLACK MAN in a Chang approaches him.

How'd you guess?
Welcome to Hong Kong. I hope you will have a            productive visit.
Thank you. I look forward to getting acquainted.
Your first visit to Hong Kong?
Yes. My first time here.
My superiors are looking forward to meeting you.
It will be my pleasure, I'm sure.
This completes the official bullshit. They look at one another. Smile. 4/6/92 D.G.. V/.H.
The space still feels grandly colonial. Overhead fans. Parquet floors. ROGERS sits behind his desk, examining Lee's credentials. English, middle aged. Uniformed.
I've been asked to give you all the help I can. I'm afraid that will be very little. We have rather a lot of our own problems just at the moment.
The man in the picture is wanted on Federal charges in the United States.
He points to a PHOTOGRAPH in the dossier in front of Roge Rogers picks it up.
A candid shot of Jeff in a restaurant --
Rogers drops the photo.
As I told you on the telephone, neither his name nor his picture shows up on our computer.
Our sources say that he's living in Hong Kong...
Rogers is reading the file.
He's charged with "depriving a citizen of his civil rights"..? You'll pardon me, but this seems a rather trivial offense...
He deprived this citizen of his civil rights by putting seven bullets in his head and body.
I'm told there are hundreds of murders a day in your country. What's so special about this one to take you so far out of your jurisdiction?
This particular citizen was a politician. Corrupt, Mafia connected, a drug trafficker, but a politician. So the Bureau does not want to appear unenthusiastic in the pursuit of his killer.
You'll pardon my own lack of enthusiasm.
We also believe he is a contract killer with at least twenty-five notches on his gun.
(perfunctory)
Not a bad number. You'll find killers for hire are rather common in Hong Kong...Of course we'll help you in any way we can.
I'll try not to be a burden.

Please remember you have neither authority nor jurisdiction here, which means if you do find him, you will inform us and we will decide what action, if any, is to be taken. You are not to apprehend him in any way yourself. Do you understand me?
Perfectly.
And I'll have your gun.
I don't carry it on social occasions.
You will not carry a gun on any occasion in the Colony.
I wouldn't dream of it.
This actually gets a smile from Rogers.
As you're here, there is something you could do for us. If you'd like..?
(smiles)
I hope ii doesn't involve carrying a gun.
Rogers is already speaking into intercom. 4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.
Ask Sergeant Chang to come in, please.

Another night. Jenny sings ANOTHER SONG. There is an oversized brandy snifter on top of her keyboa Across the way Jeff stands at the bar, watching her. He finishes his drink. Approaches Jenny. Jeff puts a wad of bills in the snifter -- Lingers a moment. She feels his presence. Turns her dead eyes in his direction.
Do you have a request?
I'm sorry. I only speak English.
Do you wish a request?
He can't answer. Moves away.
Some of the other clubs on the street are already closed. Others are closing. Jeff comes out of the Pale Flower. Lights a cigarette. Moves off down the street.
Jenny is packing up to leave. She takes the money from the snifter. Puts it in her purse. A WAITER tries to help her to the door --
It's all right, I can manage by myself.
Do you have a ride home?
There's a cab stand at the end of the street. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
Wait a minute. I'll walk with you..
Please. I'll be all right by myself.
She knows the way out. No need for the white cane she carries.
Jenny  comes   out  of   the  nightclub. Turns  left  and  starts up  the street. Now she needs the cane --

Behind her a MOTORCYCLE comes slowly up the street. TWO RIDERS. They trail her for a moment. Speed up -- The passenger GRABS Jenny's bag. Knocks her over. The Driver accelerates... Gets about ten feet. Jeff suddenly appears out of the sha A FLYING KICK sends Driver and Passenger sprawling. The motorcycle CRASHES into a flower stand --
Pounces on the Kid with Jenny's bag Grabs the bag as the Driver runs off. Jeff indicates the other Kid should follow him -- He does. And fast.
On her hands and knees groping for her cane -- Jeff comes over to her. Tries to help her up -- She thinks it's one of the muggers -- Wrenches free.
Help! Get away from me.
Wait...
She finds her cane and swings it at him. He catches it. Then grabs her hands. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
I m trying to help you.
She stops struggling.
I'm sorry.
Are you all right?
He hands her her bag.
Thank you. Is this my bag?
Yes. A couple of guys on a motorcycle tried to take it. They're gone now.
You got it back?
It's all over now. Can I take you home?
Thank you, but you've done enough for me already --
Starts to move off. He falls into step next to her --
Then, maybe you can reward me by letting me take       you home.
You were in the club. You spoke to me, left me         money --
I come a lot to hear you sing --
She takes his arm. They move down the street.
You're an American?
From New York. It's almost the same thing. My          name is Jeff.                                          4/6/92 D.G.. W.H.
You speak no Cantonese?
Twenty or thirty words...
Then you don't understand the songs?
It's probably better that way. Here's the car.
He opens the door and helps her into the car. It's difficult for her.
I hate being so helpless...
He adjusts the safety belt around her.
I hate it. I'll never get used to it.
As he closes the door --
The apartment is simple and spare. A piano. Sophisticated sound system. Jeff opens the door and turns on a LIGHT --
Would you like me to have a look around? Just to be       safe?
Thank you. Coming home alone still scares me.
Don't you have a boyfriend?
I got rid of him. I feel sorry enough for myself. I       didn't need any more help.
Jeff looks around the apartment. Stops near a high table. Looks at some photographs of Jenny -- Winning a talent contest. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
Playing tennis. An album cover. It's painful for him.
You sure that's the way he felt?
It's the way I felt... Would you like something to       drink? I think I have some brandy.
I don't want to keep you up.
You won't be. Please have a drink. I'll have one too.
She has moved to a cabinet and is fumbling among the bott
I can get it.
It might be better. At least you'll know what you're getting. I'm still not too good at fumbling in the       dark.
He moves to the cabinet.
You can't see at all?
I can see light. Shapes.
He's poured two snifters of cognac. Gives her one. Jenny lifts the glass to toast him.
(smiles)                                 'Brighter days ahead.
They drink.
Isn't there anything that can be done? An operation      or something?
No. The optic nerve is damaged. They say it might        heal by itself, but it might not.
On the nearby coat rack Jeff sees his scarf -- From the night of the shooting. 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
Blood stained. He touches it...
Wouldn't you like to sit down?
He doesn't move.
You're looking at the scarf, aren't you?
The bloodstains are yours?
The man who did this to me used it to bandage me.
Why do you keep it?
I keep momentos of all the big events in my life.
Jeff doesn't have much to say to this.

I'm sorry I'm so bitter, but I can't stop myself --      I should be brave and cheerful. Positive and op-        timistic. But, I don't feel any of that. Maybe I will sometime, but not now. I'm blind and depressed and      bad tempered. Good company, don't you think?
I was never crazy about brave and cheerful.
He sits down next to her.
I haven't seen my face in six months. I wonder if I've lost my looks.
You don't have to worry.
Are you feeling sorry for me or taking advantage of me?
Both.
He kisses her. She accepts the kiss. Seems to enjoy it. Then suddenly pulls back... 4/6/92 D.G., W.H.
I think you should go.
She stands. So does he.
Can I see you again?
No. It's not a good idea.
I'd like to.
I sing every night in a bar. You can see me there.
Okay. I'll see you tomorrow.
Moves to the door. Looks back and smiles. Realizes it's a smile she'll never see. Turns and goes.

something~ goes wrong, don't give it a second            thought. Shoot first and ask questions later.

Chang takes out his wallet.
Officer, do we really...

Call the police. I won't stop you.

All day today, I remembered. I was hoping to see you. I thought maybe you'd come to the bar, but then I didn't know. (sighs)                                              I'm talking to you like I've already slept with you. You know why?
He shakes his head.
You've already changed my life more than any man I've ever met...
Jeff and Jenny are making love.

Sometimes.
I  always  did.  But  when you  can't  open  them. It's not the same. Anyway, I can't  really explain  it yet. It's my first  time, you  know. I  mean my  first time since...
He gets out of bed, moves to a cabinet. Pours two glasses of wine from an open bottle.
I thought it was you before you told me.
How?
Wouldn't you know me in the dark? My smell. My          presence...?
Is that really true? (Hai ma?)
It's true. (Hai ya).
He returns to the bed, hands her a glass.
And you went with me anyway?
That's all you need to know about me.

You need to know more about me. I'm a killer. I         don't know how to explain it. I'm good at it. I get paid well. I decide who I'm going to kill. It's w%at I do. It's all I've ever done. Kill people. But I still think of myself as a good man. And I want to be         with you. Now. Tomorrow. Next week. Next                month. Next year.
You're in love with me. Yes? But you have to be in      love with me to justify hurting someone innocent --
You think that's true?
Yes. But its' good. I'll have you forever. You have      to live a long time. For me. You owe it to me.           4/6/92 D.G., %W.H.
